data.title: Remove workerMainCompatibility.html
JSON schema error message ignored
data.body:
Have the following json schema attribute 

``` json
"externalConsole": {
                    "type": "boolean",
                    "description": "%node.launch.externalConsole.description%",
                    "default": true,
                    "errorMessage": "Hello martin",
                    "enum": []
                }
```

Notice that the error message is being ignored. It is only repsected in the case that the attribute has a `pattern` which is not respected.

Need this for #11209

data.title: Disable 'dir' traversal
Figure out a way to freeze the builds
Fix #11284 - Resolve tokens found in settings referenced by launch.json
data.body:
This fixes the issue (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/11284):
- Launch.json can reference settings defined in settings.json via the syntax ${config.python.pythonPath}
- if a setting in setting.json such as python.pythonPath="abc", then the value received in the debugger via launch.json is "abc"
- However if the value for python.pythonPath="${workspaceRoot}/bin/python", then the value received by the debugger is "${workspaceRoot}/bin/python", when the value ${workspaceRoot} should be resolved.

Solution is to treat all values referenced by the syntax ${config...} as values that need to be resolved.

data.title: syntax highlighting of powershell (ps1) files
data.body:
The syntax highlighting of powershell has not working correct
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Win7Pro

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Paste this code in vscode and save it as *.ps1

```
Add-type -assembly "Microsoft.Office.Interop.Outlook" | out-null
$olFolders = "Microsoft.Office.Interop.Outlook.olDefaultFolders" -as [type]
$outlook = new-object -comobject outlook.application
$namespace = $outlook.GetNameSpace("MAPI")
$folder = $namespace.getDefaultFolder($olFolders::olFolderInBox)
$folder.items | ?{$_.Subject -like "Lorem Ipsum*"} | 
 %{
    $regexResult = $_.HTMLBody | Select-String -Pattern "Lorem Ipsum: <b>(\d{1,})<\/b>" -AllMatches
    $numVirus =  $regexResult.Matches.Groups[1].Value

    $properties = @{
      'NumberVirus'=$numVirus;
      'Date'= $_.CreationTime
      }
    $object = New-Object –TypeName PSObject –Prop $properties
    $object
  } | Tee-Object -Variable result

  $result | Out-GridView
```
1.  You will see a few statements with none syntax highlighting. (e.g.   `} | Tee-Object -Variable result`)
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6566207/18122181/88a4a95a-6f68-11e6-98e4-2503b25d68b8.png)

data.title: Changing file icon theme to none applies it to only one VSCode window
data.body:
Refs: #11130
- VSCode Version: insider
- OS Version: linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open two vscode windows, enable seti icon theme
2. In one of those windows set icon theme to 'none'
3. Notice that this none theme only gets applied to that window, not the other one. Also notice that setting icon theme to anything other than 'none' nicely applies it to both windows

data.title: Tokens defined in settings.json not resolved when the setting is referenced via launch.json
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.4
- OS Version:OS X

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Download [Python Extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=donjayamanne.python)
2. Create a simple python file with the following code `print(1)`
3. Install a virtual environment under "p27" subdirectory of the workspace root.
4. Define the path to python interpreter as follows `"python.pythonPath":"${workspaceRoot}/p27/bin/python"`  
5. Ensure the path to the pythonPath in launch.json is configured as follows `"pythonPath": "${config.python.pythonPath}"`  
6. Debug the file created in step 2.

Error displayed:
`Failed to launch the Python Process, please validate the path '${workspaceRoot}/p27/bin/python'`

Problem: The token ${workspaceRoot} has not been resolved to the workspace root path.

The bug is in [configVariables](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/903a011485215a29b20c1b1a33ddfaeb46f9e85d/src/vs/workbench/parts/lib/node/configVariables.ts#L35). 
The value returned contains the tokens ${workspaceRoot} that needs to be resolved.

data.title: IPython: Running Selected Text in Terminal Only Executes First Line of Code

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4
- OS Version: OSX 10.10.5

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open integrated terminal and run `ipython`.
2. Type at least two lines of code in editor, with the last line calling a print() function.
3. Highlight text and use command `Terminal: Run Selected Text in Active Terminal`.

The IPython session will only run the first line of code rather than all selected text.

![screen shot 2016-08-31 at 12 34 35 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/21263827/18117356/bf40fedc-6f13-11e6-98aa-e87807dd569f.png)

Note that this behavior is different than the Windows version described in #11253; there, the entirety of the selected text does run (although the user must hit enter after using the run selected text command).

data.title: window API: allow to register click on StatusBarItem
data.body: Currently `vscode.StatusBarItem` has property `command` which it invokes on click, it would be useful if one could register custom callback on click.

data.title: Allow for false `files.exclude` and `search.exclude` rules to override other rules

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
`files.exclude` and `searh.exclude` should respect exclusion from those rules

``` js
"files.exclude": {
  "**/*.js": true, // will hide all js
  "some-module.js": false // currently effects nothing should prevent 'some-module.js' from being hidden
}
```
